title: Senior UX Designer – Flight Operations
description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.


Senior UX Designer – Flight Operations


The Boeing Digital Aviation Solutions (BDAS) Design Team is operating at the heart of our innovation centers where we conduct best-in-class aviation research and quickly turn market-driven ideas into products. We leverage industry best-practices, such as Agile Software Development, Pragmatic Marketing, gated processes, and self-directed teams, to develop new and innovative digital products for our customers.


For our Planning and Flight Operations portfolio, we are looking for a **Senior User Experience (UX) Designer** who will support designing software for commercial aircraft customers providing them competitive advantage by solving real operational problems, enabling better decisions, maximizing efficiency, and improving environmental performance. This position is available in Gothenburg (Sweden) and allows for a hybrid work model providing the flexibility of working from home and being onsite when required.


In your assignment, you will research and design workflows and user interfaces for web applications and services for our Flight Operations and Crew Management customers. Design work is primarily done in Figma but not limited to it.


You will also be part of the larger BDAS User Experience (UX) organization of over 100 researchers, product designers, and data analysts where you will benefit from, and contribute to, our DesignOps initiatives, such as our design system, training program, ResearchOps, and tools working groups. You will report to a Design manager with over 25 years of experience in the design industry who cares deeply about mentorship and your career development.

**Tasks & Expectations:**


In alignment with our Design Thinking process, you will:

* Empathize: You will help to plan and direct research activities in collaboration with research specialists.
* Define: You collaborate with researchers, lead the analysis and synthesis of research data, coordinate the creation of journey maps, scenarios, service blueprints, and other documentation.
* Ideate: You lead the team in the development of solutions through brainstorming, sketching, and creation of mockups, ensuring regular reviews and reporting status. You will coordinate presentations and other communication.
* Prototype: You will oversee the creation of prototypes and coordinate presentations to management and other stakeholders.
* Test: Senior UX designers plan and conduct testing activities, working directly with users and collecting feedback. They ensure results are reported and incorporated into future revisions.
* Implement: You coordinate with the development team to ensure proper collaboration and oversee design system use.
* Measure: You collaborate with data analysts to ensure the correct metrics are tracked and actioned.

**Required Qualifications:**

* Longstanding applied experience in design process, design methods, design principles, and a solid intuition.
* Proven track record of working with human-centered-design methodologies on high-quality, digital products.
* Driven by curiosity and eager to work in one of the most exciting industries on the planet.
* Ability to discuss eye-to-eye with stakeholders like Engineering Managers, Product Owners, etc.
* Excellent communicator of design work and your rationale behind proposals to internal stakeholders and customers.
* Team player and self-starter who can organize activities and deeply collaborate with other designers and subject matter experts.
* Ability to contribute meaningful approaches for how to collaboratively run UX research in agile teams.
* Capability to creatively synthesize insights, build intuitively understandable insight formats, and drive decision making.
* Ability to facilitate collaborative workshops with team members and stakeholders.
* Strong written and verbal communications skills in English.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Understanding of aviation and/or aviation related processes would be highly desirable.
* Experience with agile methods (e.g., SAFe).
* MA (Master of Arts) / MS (Master of Science) in User Experience Design, Industrial Design, Psychology, Human Computer Interaction, or related disciplines and typically 8 or more years of related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

**Your application documents should contain:**

* A cover letter reviewing your experiences and your interest.
* Your CV.
* Copies of references from your former employers (if available).


Additionally, your application should include a strong portfolio (online or pdf (max 2 MB)) demonstrating your research process and associated results.

**What we offer:**

* Competitive salary that grows as you grow.
* Hybrid working possibilities.
* Health insurance and pension plans with our preferred providers.
* Access to a rapidly growing global design organization and the ability to shape it.

**Relocation:** This position does not offer relocation. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.

**Visa Sponsorship:** Employer will initiate the visa application; however, the successful candidate will cover the cost of visa.

  

Applications for this position will be accepted until **Jul. 18, 2025**

 **Export Control Requirements:** This is not an Export Control position. **Relocation**

Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit for this position.

**Visa Sponsorship**

Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.

**Shift**

Not a Shift Worker (Sweden)

 **Equal Opportunity Employer:**


We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not accept unlawful discrimination in our recruitment or employment practices on any grounds including but not limited to; race, color, ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military and veteran status, or other characteristics covered by applicable law.


We have teams in more than 65 countries, and each person plays a role in helping us become one of the world’s most innovative, diverse and inclusive companies. We are proud members of the Valuable 500 and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities. Applicants are encouraged to share with our recruitment team any accommodations required during the recruitment process. Accommodations may include but are not limited to: conducting interviews in accessible locations that accommodate mobility needs, encouraging candidates to bring and use any existing assistive technology such as screen readers and offering flexible interview formats such as virtual or phone interviews.
company_description: Boeing is the world's largest aerospace company. We’re engineers & technicians. Innovators & dreamers. Join us, and build something better.

title: UX lead, nivå 4
description:
Vi söker en engagerad och erfaren **UI/UX-lead** till ett uppdrag hos vår kund. Uppdraget innebär ett viktigt bidrag i utvecklingen av samhällskritiska digitala tjänster med fokus på användarupplevelse, tillgänglighet och säkerhet. Du kommer att arbeta i ett team som värdesätter struktur, samarbete och lösningsfokus – och där ditt arbete får verklig betydelse för både medborgare och offentlig verksamhet.

### **Om uppdraget**


Som UI/UX-lead får du en nyckelroll i att driva och samordna designarbetet i ett omfattande projekt som syftar till att skapa moderna, tillgängliga och användarvänliga digitala gränssnitt. Tjänsten riktar sig till invånare och verksamheter inom offentlig sektor och ställer höga krav på säkerhet, teknisk komplexitet och användarcentrerad design. Du kommer att samarbeta med interna UX-team och projektledare, delta i designbeslut, bidra till användartester och ta fram lösningar som fungerar för många olika målgrupper – inklusive användare med särskilda behov.

### **Skall-krav:**

* Minst fyra års erfarenhet av att arbeta genom hela designprocessen i en kombinerad UI/UX-roll
* Minst fyra års erfarenhet av tillgänglig och inkluderande design, med god kunskap om WCAG
* Minst fyra års erfarenhet av gränssnittsdesign för tekniskt komplexa system med höga säkerhetskrav
* Minst fyra års erfarenhet av arbete med gränssnitt för verksamhetskritiska system
* Erfarenhet av att leda UX-arbete i större projektmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av att ta fram användarstöd, exempelvis guider eller instruktionsfilmer
* God förståelse för identitetshantering och behörighetsstyrning
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift
* Minst tre års erfarenhet av att arbeta med designverktyget Figma
* Vana vid att arbeta både självständigt och tillsammans med andra
* Tillgänglig för arbete på plats i Stockholm minst två dagar per vecka

### **Meriterande (bedöms vid intervju)**

* God samarbetsförmåga
* Djup kompetens inom UI och UX
* Erfarenhet från hälso- och sjukvårdssektorn
* Erfarenhet från offentlig sektor
* Förmåga att arbeta lösningsorienterat och målinriktat

### **Arbetsform**


Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med kundens team. Du kommer att ha regelbundna avstämningar varje vecka, både digitalt och fysiskt. Inera har kontor i centrala Stockholm där du förväntas arbeta på plats minst två dagar per vecka. Kommunikation sker på både svenska och engelska.

title: Junior Product Designer
description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.
   

  

 To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.
   

  

 For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.
   

  

**A few examples of your responsibilities** 
* Help shape outstanding user experiences and impact the success of our products by creating flawless UI and UX designs, from conceptualization to delivery. You’ll take a human-first approach to designing products, ensuring they delight users by being as effective as they are aesthetically pleasing.
* Make use of prototyping tools to ensure your designs are intuitive and to explore new, innovative ways of designing interactions.
* Work closely with product managers and software engineers to propose new features and improve the quality of both mobile and desktop apps.
* Focus on user testing and research to ensure our customers are always at the core of our product designs.
* Find, together with engineers, the most efficient trade-off between high-value solutions for users and the complexity of implementation.
* Leverage usage data to evaluate the impact of your designs, and apply your learnings to the next iterations.


**What we look for** 
* **Reasoning ability.** 
 Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
* **Drive.** 
 You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
* **Team spirit.** 
 You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
* **Proficiency in English.** 
 You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


**What we offer** 
* **Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams.** 
 You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
* **An exceptional opportunity for growth.** 
 We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
* **Competitive pay and access to equity in the company.** 
 Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £54,545 in the UK and €52,246 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £66,779 and £149,636 in the UK, and €63,965 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
* **All. These. Benefits.** 
 Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


**Commitment & contract**
 Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.
   

  

**Location**
 Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.
   

  

**Before you apply**
 Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.
   

  

**The selection process**
 If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.
   

  

 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.
   

  

 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

title: Product Designer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 - We’re looking for world-class product designers to help shape Lovable. You’ll lead projects end-to-end, collaborating closely with engineering. We expect a broad range of design skills, and exceptional taste. You’ll join a team at the forefront of AI, enabling anyone to create software.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* A track record of working in high performing, fast-paced startup environments
* A portfolio showcasing successful product work loved by users and produced in high-velocity teams
* Talent for simplifying complicated user journeys into intuitive experiences
* Strong prototyping abilities with emphasis on clear visual communication
* Fluency with design systems and technical implementations
* Outstanding command of visual design, UI patterns, and interaction principles
* High aptitude for shipping and learning extraordinarily quickly
* Bonus: You ship to production, perhaps with a little help from AI
* Bonus: Experience designing AI products


**What You’ll Do**
**In one sentence:** 
 Design Lovable, making it the most Lovable piece of software ever.
   

  

* Craft detailed user flows and high-fidelity mockups for new features
* Own design projects from conception to delivery, collaborating with engineering or ideally implementing yourself with AI (we'll train you)
* Be scrappy and hands on with any design assets needed
* Establish scalable design processes that uphold quality standards
* Champion quick wins and impactful improvements
* Contribute to improving the design quality of Lovable's AI
* Help set the bar for design quality and the culture for how design works at Lovable


**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
* We'll send you a quick take-home asking to present your best work over a loom video presentation.
* Join us for a round of interviews to discuss your experience in more depth
* Join us for trial work lasting 1-2 days remote or on-site. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.


**Important Note** 
 :
   

  

* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal.

title: Head of E-commerce
description:
**About Happy Mammoth**
 Happy Mammoth is a fast-growing natural food tech business selling across the United States, Australia and Europe. We specialize in formulating, producing and marketing gut, digestive and microbiome health foods and natural supplements, designed to help our clients make long-lasting positive health changes and start living very full lives again.
   

  

 If you're passionate about optimizing ecommerce funnels, increasing conversion rates, and driving measurable revenue growth through smart, data-backed strategies, this is the opportunity for you.
   

  

**This is a managerial position where you will lead a team of 5-6 different specialists.**
 What You’ll Be Doing
   

  

 You will lead all of Happy Mammoth’s Head of E-commerce efforts across Shopify stores, landing pages, sales funnels, quizzes, and special campaign assets (like Black Friday and Valentine’s Day launches).
   

  

 You’ll be responsible for both strategy and execution - working hands-on with our developers and designers to bring ideas to life and optimize the entire customer journey.
   

  

 Conversion Rate Optimization and Growth Strategy
   

  

* Analyze user behavior through heatmaps, session recordings, and funnel analytics to identify friction points and prioritize optimization initiatives
* Set up, execute, and analyze A/B tests to increase conversion rates across landing pages, product pages, quizzes, checkout flows, and upsells
* Lead optimization projects to improve the CR of our Shopify stores, sales funnels, and newly launched campaigns
* Develop strategies to increase AOV


 Asset Development for Acquisition and Campaigns
   

  

* Plan, develop, and optimize new acquisition assets such as quizzes, landing pages, and special product launch pages
* Work closely with the development and design teams to build high-converting, fast-loading ecommerce experiences
* Collaborate with the marketing team during product launches and peak sales periods to maximize performance


 Execution and Team Collaboration
   

  

* Translate insights into clear action plans for developers and designers
* Ensure all pages and funnels are mobile-optimized, user-friendly, fast, and designed for high conversion
* Track key metrics like conversion rate, bounce rate, AOV, and page speed to ensure continuous improvement


 What We’re Looking For
   

  

* 5+ years experience in CRO, ecommerce optimization, or digital growth roles
* Deep knowledge of user behavior analysis, funnel building, and A/B testing methodologies
* Strong hands-on experience with Shopify and ecommerce tech stacks
* Project management skills — able to run and communicate projects smoothly across teams
* A strategic and data-driven mindset with a love for experimentation
* A proactive, solution-oriented attitude and a passion for ownership
* Bonus points for experience in high-growth DTC (direct-to-consumer) brands


 Why Work With Us?
   

  

* 100% remote—work from anywhere in the world
* Be part of a fast-growing, non-corporate company where speed and creativity matter
* Work with a high-performance team that values ownership, autonomy, and results
* Access to training, tools, and a culture of innovation and growth


 Ready to Optimize, Scale, and Create Beautiful E-commerce Experiences?
   

  

 Apply now
   

  

 Powered by JazzHR
   

  

 KD6XbYrB1w

title: Senior UX-designer
description:
**Vi på Combitech i Stockholm söker nu en senior UX-designer för att stärka vårt framstående UX-team. I denna roll kommer du att arbeta med att utveckla engagerande och intuitiva användarupplevelser samt kommunicera designlösningarnas värde.** 
**Har du erfarenhet av att sälja in UX-design till kunder och tidigare arbetat som konsult? Då kan du vara den vi letar efter.**
**På Combitech erbjuder vi en unik möjlighet att som konsult arbeta i teknikens framkant tillsammans med våra kunder, främst inom försvars- och fordonsindustrin, samt inom andra spännande områden.**
 Rollen
   

  

 I den här rollen får du möjlighet att:
   

  

* Hjälpa till att bygga upp ett designteam och vara med i dialogen med våra kunder där UX-design inte alltid är en självklarhet.
* Leda designprocessen från idé till leverans, säkerställa att användarupplevelsen är i världsklass hos våra kunder.
* Arbeta nära kunder för att förstå deras behov och översätta dessa till kreativa och funktionella designlösningar.
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att säkerställa att designen integreras sömlöst med tekniska och affärsmässiga mål.


 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* Har minst 10 års erfarenhet inom UX-design.
* Har en universitetsutbildning med examen inom interaktionsdesign, industridesign, kognitionsvetenskap el liknande.
* Har arbetat som konsult tidigare, är affärsmässig och van vid införsäljning av UX-kompetens till kunder.
* Har stor erfarenhet av att initiera och leda workshops och har drivit både strategiska projekt och utvecklingsprojekt.
* Har erfarenhet av användarcentrerad design i en komplex verksamhet.
* Har goda kunskaper av att arbeta med designverktyg som Figma och har kompetens inom tillgänglighet (WCAG).
* Kan flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Är självständig, initiativrik och har ett strategiskt tänkande. Erfarenhet av att coacha och inspirera andra designers och team är meriterande.


**Då tjänsten innebär arbete som omfattas av försvarssekretess krävs det att du genomför och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll.**
**Urval sker efter sista ansökningsdag pga sommarsemster. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
 Kom & gör skillnad
   

  

 Vi tror att man gör ett bättre jobb om man kan fokusera på rätt saker, därför gör vi det lätt att kombinera jobbet med vardagen. Vi satsar på våra medarbetare, de utgör kärnan, hjärnan och hjärtat i vår verksamhet. Dessutom står vi på en stadig grund av högteknologi, forskning och anställningstrygghet med försvars- och säkerhetskoncernen Saab som ägare.
   

  

 För oss handlar det om hållbarhet - vi vill bli branschens mest hållbara företag; och för att vara ett hållbart företag i en hållbar framtid behöver vi investera i våra medarbetare. För oss är din återhämtning, dina utvecklingsmöjligheter och din trygghet lika viktigt som företagets framgång - utan våra medarbetare står vi stilla.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss? Kolla in våra karriärsidor på vår webb!
   

  

 Kontaktperson: Therese Elwing, therese.elwing@combitech.com
   

  

 Vi undanber oss rekryteringssamarbeten.

title: Scrum Master/Technical Project Lead
description:
Assignment Description
   

  

 We are now looking for a consultant to join the team for approximately one year, starting in 2 months.
   

  

**ASSIGNMENT**
 As a Scrum Master / Technical Project Lead, you will play a key role in driving and coordinating the work of a skilled cross-functional development team within interior lighting. The team works at the intersection of mechatronics, optics, and electronics, where your ability to balance technical understanding with structured leadership is essential.
   

  

 You won’t need to do detailed design work yourself, but you are expected to understand and manage deliveries, coordinate between disciplines, and support the team in agile processes.
   

  

**Requirements Profile**
 We are looking for a person with:
   

  

 Extensive experience from the customer’s systems, processes, and tools
   

  

 Background as component owner, Scrum Master, Technical Project Manager, or Product Owner
   

  

 Good understanding or strong interest in mechatronics, and ideally some knowledge of electronics and optics
   

  

 Advantageous if you have an academic background in physics, electronics, or mechatronics
   

  

**Meriting:**
 Experience from working on electronic platform development
   

  

 Knowledge of optical systems and how light is controlled and distributed
   

  

 Experience from Automotive industry
   

  

 Location: Södertälje, Onsite
   

  

 Other relevant information
   

  

 Desired Competences
   

  

 Computer Aided Engineering (CAE)
   

  

 Lighting, Acoustics and Experience Design
   

  

 Mechanical Engineering (Product and Machine Design)
   

  

 Electronics System and Communication technology
   

  

**Start Date: 2025-10-01** 
**Last submission Date: 2025-07-30**
 We will be presenting candidates ongoing basis, so please send your application asap.
   

  

 Looking forward to receive your application!

title: CRO Analyst/Content Specialist
company_industry: Wholesale Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics and Retail Appliances, Electrical, and Electronic Equipment
description:
We are currently looking for an CRO Analyst/Content Specialist to an exciting opportunity with our client Samsung! This is a consultancy opportunity starting as soon as possible and the assignment is until further notice.
 



  





**About the company:** 




*Help Us Create What Can´t Be Done* 




 Everything we do at Samsung is driven by an unyielding passion for excellence—and an unfaltering commitment to develop the best products and services on the market. In today´s fast-paced global economy, change is constant and innovation is critical to a company´s survival. As we have done for 80 years, we set our sights on the future, anticipating market needs and demands so we can steer our company toward long-term success.
 



  





**Purpose of the role:** 




 We´re looking for a hands-on CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) & Content Specialist to join our team and play a key role in optimizing our eStore´s conversion rates and user experience. You will be a part of the Marcom & CX team, involved in projects and improvements where specific skills and recommendations are needed. Working closely with site owner, marketing, UX, and data analytics, diving into analytics dashboards, run A/B tests, and refine on-page content to boost engagement and sales.
 



  





**Job Scope & Key Deliverables:** 



* End-to-End CRO Accountability: Own conversion rate optimization strategy together with other CX Team members, analysing customer behaviour and implementing data-driven improvements across the eStore.
* Experience & Content Optimization: Continuously refine key flows, A/B test layouts, and optimize on-page content to improve engagement and conversion.
* Data-Driven Decision Making: Use analytics tools to monitor performance, identify bottlenecks, and implement data-backed improvements.
* Traffic & Funnel Optimization: Ensure alignment between traffic sources and landing page experiences to maximize conversion rates.
* Performance Monitoring & Insights: Track key CRO metrics, including bounce rate, time on page, exit rates, and conversion paths.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Communicate test results, insights, and recommendations to leadership and cross-functional teams.
* Collaboration: Collaborate with European Office representatives - CRO consultants, analysts, and content specialists to drive initiatives and align on goals, timelines, and success metrics.



  





**Role Tasks:** 



* Daily Performance Monitoring: Review eStore analytics dashboards, track traffic trends, and analyze conversion funnels.
* A/B Testing & Experimentation: Develop A/B and conduct tests to optimize product pages, category layouts, and checkout flows.
* Content & Visual Merchandising: Update and test banners, product highlights, and promotional elements to ensure maximum engagement and click-through rates.
* Collaboration & Communication: Work closely with site owners Marketing, UX, and Data Analytics teams to align on optimization strategies.
* Reporting & Insights: Provide weekly/monthly reports on key CRO metrics, highlighting wins and areas for further testing.



  





**What makes this role interesting for a candidate?** 



* This role is perfect for someone who loves getting into the details, testing new ideas, and collaborating with a team to drive data-backed improvements.
* If you´re analytical, creative, and eager to make an impact, we´d love to hear from you!



  





**Main competence:** 



* Analysing and Interpreting - Shows evidence of clear analytical thinking. Gets to the heart of complex problems and issues. Applies own expertise effectively. Quickly learns new technology. Communicates well in writing.
* Organising and Executing - Plans ahead and works in a systematic and organised way. Follows directions and procedures. Focuses on customer satisfaction and delivers a quality service or product to the agreed standards.
* Supporting and Co-operating - Supports others and shows respect and positive regard for them in social situations. Puts people first, working effectively with individuals and teams, clients and staff. Behaves consistently with clear personal values that complement those of the organization.



  





**Most relevant qualifications, education and training:** 



* Degree in Business, Data Analytics, or related field
* Experience in e-commerce, CRO, A/B testing, and UX optimization
* Strong understanding of site navigation, checkout flows, and purchase behavior.
* Hands-on experience with A/B testing and analytics tools.
* Familiarity with customer journey mapping and conversion funnel analysis.



  





**Most relevant previous work experience:** 



* Comfortable with content management systems, analytics tools, and an ability to interpret data into clear next steps.
* Experience working with Jira, Adobe Target, Adobe Analytics, Content Square, Figma.
* Strong multitasking skills with experience managing CRO initiatives.
* Ability to communicate test results and insights to cross-functional teams.
* Analytical thinker with a passion for experimentation and continuous improvement.
* Skilled at identifying and solving conversion bottlenecks. Customer-focused and data-driven, with a strong drive to achieve results and exceed targets.
* Experience in preparing decision support materials for A/B test approval, ensuring alignment with objectives and guidelines to drive data-driven decision-making.



  





**Required language skills:** 



* Fluency in English & Swedish



  





**Required travel days per year:** 



* 10 days, to Poland



  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you are up for the challenge and reckon that this position fits your profile, we would like to hear from you. Apply today, as we are reviewing applications ongoingly and the position might be filled before the application deadline.

title: Senior Learning Consultant, Sales & Commercial Enablement (Europe and APAC Regions)
description:
Senior Learning Consultant, Sales & Commercial Enablement (Europe and APAC)
   

  

 A Senior Learning Consultant, Sales & Commercial Enablement (Commercial Academy) at DLL is a member of the global L&D Leadership Team and specializes in the design and delivery of effective learning programs, sales training and enablement – building sustainable and impactful sales capabilities and skills across our commercial organizations.
   

  

 In partnership with DLL’s Commercial Effectiveness and Transformation team, this role will be regionally aligned to the Europe and APAC regions but with a global impact on our commercial organization. Responsible for leading both strategy development and execution in the aligned region with the goal of enabling our commercial members to be more effective, efficient, and successful.
   

  

 Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL
   

  

**Day To Day**
* Program management: Oversee the end-to-end process of commercial learning programs – from design, development, delivery, evaluation and impact.
* Needs assessment: Identify and prioritize commercial capabilities and skills and determine learning needs, including user research.
* Sustainable and scalable learning architecture design: Design personalized, sustainable and scalable commercial learning architecture and solutions, which includes a blend of learning experiences, learning journeys, coaching and resources.
* Digital tools and AI: Leverage digital tools, including AI, to enhance the overall learning experience.
* Learning journeys: Develop and implement capability-based learning journeys to support DLL commercial member development and career advancement.
* Facilitate learning and deliver training: Lead engaging and participatory learning sessions to ensure participants can experience and practice new capabilities and skills.
* Lead Network/Community of Facilitators: develop and coach a network of facilitators in the commercial organization who can develop, deliver, and evaluate commercial learning programs.
* Evaluate effectiveness and impact: Using global L&D evaluation framework, measure the effectiveness and impact of learning programs through feedback, performance metrics and assessments.
* Collaborate with stakeholders and vendors: Work with DLL members and external training providers to design and deliver leadership development programs.
* Stay up to date: Research and learn about trends and best practices in sales enablement, digital transformation and learning and development.
* Manage content strategy: Develop, maintain and update content strategy and training materials to ensure they reflect current products, services, and sales strategies.
* Being a Thought leader: Represent the Talent and Global L&D teams as a Thought Leader in DLL Commercial and Sales.


**All members enjoy**
* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity.
* Health and Wellness program including healthy food, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities.
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs.
* Click this link for an overview of all the benefits in your region.


 “We create an inclusive workplace that unleashes the full potential of our members.”
   

  

**Essentials**
**Technical**
* Sales enablement: 8+ years of experience in sales training, sales enablement, or sales leader preferred
* Digital literacy: Skilled with digital tools and AI and ability to train others in those areas
* Cognitive processes: Understanding how people think, learn, and remember information.
* Learning design: Deep knowledge of instructional design and learning experience design, delivery and evaluation of effectiveness with a focus on adult learners
* Global matrix organization: Experience of working in an international, multi-cultural, and matrix environment would hasten your onboarding journey.
* Leasing and financial services: Previous industry experience in leasing, financial services a nice to have
* Change management: Experience with leading change projects
* Social learning theories: Familiarity with theories like Bandura's Social Learning Theory, which emphasizes learning through observation and modeling.


**Interpersonal**
* Active Listening: Paying attention to others' contributions and responding thoughtfully.
* Adaptability: Being open to new ideas and flexible in learning from different people and situations.
* Customer-centric: Ability to understand and focus on the needs of customers and key stakeholders in all learning-related activities and projects.
* Data-driven: Ability to analyze and interpret data for the purpose of impactful storytelling and reporting.
* Digital literacy: Ability to work with digital learning tools and applications, including genAI and other AI applications.
* Collaboration Skills: Ability to work well with others, including teamwork and cooperation.
* Communication Skills: Clear and effective communication is crucial for sharing ideas, feedback, and knowledge.
* Empathy: Understanding and sharing the feelings of others to foster a supportive learning environment.
* Results driven: Ability to deliver on set goals and objectives and do so on time and within budget.
* Problem-Solving Skills: Working together to find solutions to challenges.


 Choose wellbeing
   

  

 DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.
   

  

**Our Four Wellbeing Categories Are As Follows**
* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities


 These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL
   

  

 Settling in
   

  

 At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.
   

  

 But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.
   

  

 Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and an honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.
   

  

 Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.
   

  

 We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind:
 **Partnering for a better world.**
**Good To Know**
* Deadline for application: 18th July 2025 (Due to high volume of applications this requisition may close prior to posted close date)
* The selection process may involve an assessment.
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website.
* DLL’s referral program applies
* Dublin, Düsseldorf, Helsinki, København, Madrid, Oslo, Paris, Stockholm, Watford
* For more information, please contact our Talent acquisition partner Dennis van Hoof via dennis.vanhoof@dllgroup.com


 DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.
   

  

 DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

title: Campaign Management Lead (m/f/d)
description:
**We are looking for a**
**Campaign Management Lead (m/f/d)**
**(unlimited, full-time) Join our team at one of our locations in Berlin, Verl or Stockholm – flexible working conditions available**
 At Riverty, we’re redefining how people and businesses interact with financial services across Europe. As our Campaign Management Lead (m/f/d), you will lead a new, cross-functional team at the intersection of data, creativity, and business growth. You'll be responsible for orchestrating full-funnel, insight-driven marketing initiatives for both consumers (B2C) and merchants (B2B) — driving measurable impact across all growth channels.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Lead, coach, and inspire a team of 10 experts in growth marketing, UX, reporting, and market research.
* Foster a high-performance culture focused on ownership, speed, and learning.
* Own the development and execution of full-funnel, international marketing campaigns for B2B and B2C.
* Optimize account-based and platform-based marketing processes to drive high-quality leads and revenue growth.
* Champion audience insights and persona development to inform campaign messaging and targeting.
* Define and monitor marketing KPIs, ensuring campaign efficiency, lead quality, and strong ROI.
* Drive UX and reporting excellence to ensure campaigns meet experience, legal, and brand standards.
* Collaborate closely with Product, Commercial, Legal, and Country Leads to ensure market fit and delivery success.


**Your Profile**
* Proven experience in leading data-driven marketing teams, with a focus on strategic campaign execution across B2B and B2C.
* Demonstrated success in account-based marketing and full-funnel campaigns that deliver measurable business results.
* Strong leadership track record in managing cross-functional, international teams.
* Analytical mindset with fluency in KPIs, marketing performance metrics, and campaign automation.
* Experience in fintech, financial services, or other regulated industries is a strong plus.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills; fluent in English, German is a plus.
* A “can-do” attitude, with the ability to prioritize what truly matters, and the ambition to continuously learn and evolve.


 #EUR35
   

  

**Benefits:**
* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: Commercial Ecommerce Manager
description:
**About the role** 




 As Ecommerce Manager at Rapunzel of Sweden you'll be responsible for the onsite experience – driving sales, optimizing content and SEO, merchandising, campaigns, and web analytics. You'll work closely with our in-house content creators to deliver a seamless customer journey and a world-class ecommerce experience. You're commercial, innovative and not afraid to take initiative. You bring a structured and analytical sharpness as well as an proactive approach.
 



  





**About Rapunzel of Sweden** 




 Rapunzel of Sweden is a leading Scandinavian beauty brand offering premium hair extensions and haircare. Founded in 2007, we serve customers internationally through our online store and salons in Sweden and Finland. We combine quality, creativity, and innovation to make dream hair accessible to everyone.
 



  





 At Rapunzel of Sweden, we believe great hair empowers confidence – and great teams build lasting brands. As a fast-growing DTC company with a strong presence in the Nordics, we’re now looking for an experienced and commercially driven Ecommerce Manager to join our team in Stockholm.
 



 We’re a company where ambition meets personal growth. We value responsibility, creativity, and initiative – and we believe that great results come when you feel trusted, supported, and inspired to grow.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 




 As Ecommerce Manager, you will be in charge of our onsite customer experience across markets. You’ll work both strategically and hands-on to optimize content, boost conversion, and ensure our site drives sales and performs at its best.
 



  





**Key responsibilities:** 



* Drive online sales by planning campaigns and optimizing evergreen content
* Plan, publish, and optimize all website content including homepage, landing and campaign pages – always based on performance insights.
* Own product placements, promotional activities, engagement and conversion-driving actions onsite. Always making sure to keep relevance and cohesion in the user experience and our communication.
* Collaborate with our content team by writing briefs for campaign assets and evergreen content for the site.
* Optimize onsite merchandising: ranking, filtering, recommendation logic, and product sorting.
* Maximize upselling and cross-selling opportunities throughout the customer journey.
* Implement and evolve onsite SEO strategies – working on evergreen content, increasing top ranked pages and increasing organic traffic and conversion.
* Manage and optimize internal search through logic for product discovery and added content
* Analyze sales performance and visitor behavior using tools like GA4, Hotjar or similar. Report and share insights on a weekly and monthly basis.
* Perform regular competitor analysis, benchmarking, and industry monitoring to keep our offer sharp.
* Ensure smart localization and market adaptation across our core geographies.



  





**Who are you?** 




 We are looking for a responsible, innovative, and proactive ecommerce professional with a strong eye content and conversion. You are commercially driven, see sales potential and act on it. You love turning data into action and have a solid understanding of how content and commercial priorities work together to create a seamless and inspiring customer journey.
 



  





**You also:** 




 • Have 3+ years of experience in ecommerce – ideally in DTC, retail, or beauty/fashion.
 



 • Are fluent in Swedish and English (written and spoken).
 



 • Feel confident working with CMS, merchandising, and analytics tools.
 



 • Have a good grasp of SEO and its role in performance marketing.
 



 • Are self-sufficient, structured, and thrive in a collaborative environment.
 



 • Take initiative, suggest improvements, and get things done.
 



 • Have experience with Centra, Storyblok, or Depict – considered a big plus.
 



  





**Nice-to-Have (or Grow-Into) Responsibilities** 




 If you’re eager to expand your scope, we’d love to see experience or interest in:
 



 • Collaborating with UX/design on A/B testing and CRO initiatives
 



 • Leading product content translations and localization workflows
 



 • Managing ecommerce tools/platforms or contributing to vendor evaluations
 



 • Structuring and refining site taxonomy, product groupings, or filter logic
 



  





**Why Join Rapunzel?** 




 • A visible and high-impact role in a fast-growing ecommerce company
 



 • A caring and collaborative team that shares knowledge and wins together
 



 • An entrepreneurial and agile culture where ideas become action – fast
 



 • Hybrid work –3 days at HQ located in Stockholm and 2 days remote work per week
 



 • Perks like staff discount, wellness allowance, and regular team activities
 



  





  





**Start date:** 
 1st of September 2025, or otherwised agreed date
 



**Employment type:** 
 Full-time, permanent position
 



**Hybrid:** 
 Remote work 2 days a week
 



  





  





**We look forward to hear from you!** 




 Send your CV and a short personal letter to us today
 



 We review applications on an ongoing basis and may fill the position before the final application deadline.
 



  





**Hiring contact** 




 Marina Ljungberg, Head of Ecom at Rapunzel of Sweden

title: FullStack Engineer
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 As a software engineer at Mentimeter, you will be an integral part of one of our cross-functional product teams, implementing designs and user experiences that will affect millions of people worldwide. You will do this with other engineers, a Product Manager, a Product Designer, and an Engineering Manager. Even though there are some specific roles in the team, we do things and solve problems together. We want you to be someone who engages with the rest of the team in product and design decisions and doesn’t shy away from discussions. This role is for someone who wants to do more than just write code 8 hours daily.
   

  

**Role**
 We’re hiring for two Product teams within the
 **Commercial area** 
 , both playing a key role in how users experience and interact with Mentimeter – but with different areas of focus:
   

  

**Team Mango - Manage and Grow Organisations**
 This team is on a mission to create a seamless and high-quality workspace experience for our users. They own core parts of the workspace management journey and constantly explore ways to improve usability, performance, and long-term value. It’s a collaborative, cross-functional setup where engineers, a designer, and a product manager work closely to shape the product end-to-end. We’re looking for someone who cares deeply about code quality, enjoys working across the stack, and thrives in a team programming environment with frequent pairing.
   

  

**Team** 
**Payments & Monetization Team**
 This team focuses on everything related to payments – from self-service checkouts to enterprise invoicing. They sit at the intersection of product, engineering, and business, working cross-functionally to power smooth transactions and reporting. Whether it’s optimizing the checkout flow, partnering with Sales to support our largest customers, or building solid reporting systems for Finance, this team contributes directly to the company’s growth and monetization efforts.
   

  

 As a software engineer, delivering value to our customers and users is essential. But an equally important task is to scale and help your juniors. To succeed in this role, you must enjoy mentoring others and getting motivated by seeing them grow not only as developers, but as engineers driving the product forward. To be successful, you should enjoy the entire product development chain of breaking down designs into feasible work, writing and testing the code, and ensuring it efficiently gets to production. This means that a reasonable amount of context-switching will be expected from you during our sprints.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 For this role, we believe at least 5 years of related work experience as a software engineer, and through your experience, you have gained a good understanding of product development. You most likely also have a master’s degree in a relevant engineering field.
   

  

 You are a reliable, high-performing individual contributor with a solid understanding of your area of specialization. You always have a good idea of what you want to do and then just do it. You embrace change and short feedback loops.
   

  

 In addition to being a good cultural fit (see our values below), we hope you bring a passion for software development, scalable architecture, and building great products. For us, it is important that everyone cares about code quality, so an interest in testing and automation is needed. Excellent communication skills and working independently and in a team are other traits we are looking for in all our colleagues. As the team is mob programming previous experience of this is valuable and you enjoy working in this way!
   

  

 Last but not least, you must have a curious mindset, be open to learning & sharing knowledge, and be interested in working with our tech stack.
   

  

 The Tech Stack At Mentimeter Consists Of a Frontend Written In React (Next.js And Typescript), And a Backend Written In Ruby (not Rails). Supported By Some Of The Following Technologies
   

  

* Tailwind CSS
* Node.js
* Redis
* PostgreSQL
* Cloudflare
* AWS


 We require someone who knows React well but not necessarily Ruby for this role. If you know Ruby, that’s great, but knowing another backend language well and being willing to learn Ruby is equally fine. It’s more important to us that you have the right attitude than the exact right skill set.
   

  

**Our Recruitment Process**
* TA interview
* Culture interview
* Competence interview
* Offer


 Please note: We’re on summer vacation and will review all applications and get back to you in August. Thanks for your patience and enjoy the summer!
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Enterprise Networking Engineer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. Our growth is made possible by the dedicated team of hundreds behind the scenes. From software developers and product managers to designers and strategists, Team UI is driven to achieve our common goal: Rethinking IT. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons - all while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

 Join forces with us on our mission to build a better IT industry. We are currently looking for an Enterprise Networking Engineer to provide support to new enterprise customers while working cross-functionally with QA, strategy, and engineering teams to drive product improvement.
   

  

***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilites**
* Provide technical support for Ubiquiti’s product lines via phone, web chat, and email
* Own incoming requests from beginning to resolution for premium customers
* Educate and provide recommendations for Ubiquiti’s products, features, and best practices
* Assisting customers with architectural design
* Troubleshoot and diagnose issues, including providing workarounds when required
* Identify areas of opportunity for improvement for user experience, working with development and product management teams
* Stay up-to-date on Ubiquiti products and related industry technologies
* Work cross-functionally with key stakeholders to provide feedback and drive product improvements


**Requirements**
* Experience with networking, including routing, switching, WiFi protocols, security, and VPNs, and an understanding of various networking protocols (TCP/IP, WireGuard, etc) and major operating systems (Linux) is preferred
* Knowledge of troubleshooting techniques and how to effectively communicate them to customers
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
* Expertise around factors that impact UX (e.g., how can we improve our products or services), and CX (e.g., how can we improve our support experience and customer interactions)
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
* Knowledge of and enthusiasm for Ubiquiti products is a bonus


**Ideal Education And Experience**
* Three-year university degree, ideally with an Engineering or technical focus
* At least 5 years of experience in a similar role
* A background in the networking industry, ideally with practical, hands-on experience
* A track record of using in-depth troubleshooting to understand and resolve customer issues


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance, and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and a hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests


***Please note that a background check will be conducted in the final stage of the recruitment process***

title: Software Architect - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
Malmö, Sweden


* Full-time
* Application and Product Development
* Hybrid
* Tietoevry Care

Job Description **At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.**

 **About us**

  

Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.

  

We are a global team of professionals working on providing products and services to different sectors from intensive care to laboratory and social care. In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. From enabling healthcare professionals to spend more valuable time with their patients to providing data for professional athletes to achieve even better results, we make all that possible. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.

 **About the role**

  

Are you passionate about leveraging modern technologies to revolutionize healthcare? If so, we invite you to join our dynamic and innovative team as a **Software Architect**! We're a tech-forward company dedicated to enhancing health and social care through open platforms, ecosystems, and adherence to leading healthcare standards like FHIR and openEHR.

  

We work in an agile, multinational organization that develops cutting-edge products and services for both public and private sectors across the Nordic countries. Our teams are committed to creating, supporting, and delivering modern solutions used by healthcare and social care professionals throughout the region.

  

While we've listed several skills and experiences that we believe would be beneficial for this role, please don't be discouraged if you don't tick every box. We're primarily looking for a **Software Architect** who is eager to learn and grow with us.

 **With us you will be responsible for**

* **Leading Product Design and Architecture**: You will lead architectural decisions that shape the future of our healthcare solutions, ensuring scalability, security, and alignment with industry standards
* **Collaborating with Global Teams and Customers**: You will understand their needs and translate them into effective technical solutions
* **Engaging with Customer Stakeholders**: You will build strong relationships to maintain a clear and predictable product vision
* **Identifying and Mitigating Risks**: You will detect gaps in architecture, security, deployment, and configuration, proposing solutions to minimize risks and enhance system integrity
* **Mentoring and Coaching Team Members**: You will guide them in resolving complex technical issues and foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement

 **We are looking for someone with:**

* Extensive Experience in Software Development and Architecture, with a proven track record in designing and implementing complex software systems
* Expertise in Healthcare Standards like FHIR, openEHR, and SMART on FHIR to ensure interoperability and compliance
* Visionary Architectural Skills to conceptualize and design holistic solution architectures that meet current and future needs
* Knowledge of Cloud and Containerization, including proficiency in public and private cloud platforms and container technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
* Agile Methodology Proficiency, with experience working in agile environments utilizing methodologies like Scrum or Kanban
* Strong Technical Skills in microservices architecture, RESTful APIs, web development, and design patterns
* Programming Expertise, with excellent coding skills in languages such as C# and experience with frontend frameworks like Angular
* DevSecOps Experience, with exposure to integrating security practices into the DevOps process to ensure secure and reliable software delivery
* **Working proficiency in Spanish**

 **As a person you are:**

* Solution-Oriented, always focused on finding effective resolutions
* Self-Motivated & Self-Organized, with the ability to manage your own tasks efficiently
* Independent and Responsible, capable of taking ownership of your work
* A Good Team Player, with attention to detail and the ability to collaborate well with others

 **What’s in it for you?**

  

With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work of developing healthcare for all of us. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! title: Software Architect - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
Uppsala, Sweden


* Full-time
* Application and Product Development
* Hybrid
* Tietoevry Care

Job Description **At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.**

 **About us**

  

Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.

  

We are a global team of professionals working on providing products and services to different sectors from intensive care to laboratory and social care. In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. From enabling healthcare professionals to spend more valuable time with their patients to providing data for professional athletes to achieve even better results, we make all that possible. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.

 **About the role**

  

Are you passionate about leveraging modern technologies to revolutionize healthcare? If so, we invite you to join our dynamic and innovative team as a **Software Architect**! We're a tech-forward company dedicated to enhancing health and social care through open platforms, ecosystems, and adherence to leading healthcare standards like FHIR and openEHR.

  

We work in an agile, multinational organization that develops cutting-edge products and services for both public and private sectors across the Nordic countries. Our teams are committed to creating, supporting, and delivering modern solutions used by healthcare and social care professionals throughout the region.

  

While we've listed several skills and experiences that we believe would be beneficial for this role, please don't be discouraged if you don't tick every box. We're primarily looking for a **Software Architect** who is eager to learn and grow with us.

 **With us you will be responsible for**

* **Leading Product Design and Architecture**: You will lead architectural decisions that shape the future of our healthcare solutions, ensuring scalability, security, and alignment with industry standards
* **Collaborating with Global Teams and Customers**: You will understand their needs and translate them into effective technical solutions
* **Engaging with Customer Stakeholders**: You will build strong relationships to maintain a clear and predictable product vision
* **Identifying and Mitigating Risks**: You will detect gaps in architecture, security, deployment, and configuration, proposing solutions to minimize risks and enhance system integrity
* **Mentoring and Coaching Team Members**: You will guide them in resolving complex technical issues and foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement

 **We are looking for someone with:**

* Extensive Experience in Software Development and Architecture, with a proven track record in designing and implementing complex software systems
* Expertise in Healthcare Standards like FHIR, openEHR, and SMART on FHIR to ensure interoperability and compliance
* Visionary Architectural Skills to conceptualize and design holistic solution architectures that meet current and future needs
* Knowledge of Cloud and Containerization, including proficiency in public and private cloud platforms and container technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
* Agile Methodology Proficiency, with experience working in agile environments utilizing methodologies like Scrum or Kanban
* Strong Technical Skills in microservices architecture, RESTful APIs, web development, and design patterns
* Programming Expertise, with excellent coding skills in languages such as C# and experience with frontend frameworks like Angular
* DevSecOps Experience, with exposure to integrating security practices into the DevOps process to ensure secure and reliable software delivery
* **Working proficiency in Spanish**

 **As a person you are:**

* Solution-Oriented, always focused on finding effective resolutions
* Self-Motivated & Self-Organized, with the ability to manage your own tasks efficiently
* Independent and Responsible, capable of taking ownership of your work
* A Good Team Player, with attention to detail and the ability to collaborate well with others

 **What’s in it for you?**

  

With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work of developing healthcare for all of us. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.

  

Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle. We want to encourage you to keep up that curiosity and deepen your knowledge on topics you’re interested in. For example, we host a ‘Keep Learning Week’ twice a year, a week where everyone at Tietoevry has the possibility to join different training courses in a truly global setting.

 **Could you be our new colleague?**

  

We look forward to hearing from you! We will fill the position as soon as we find the right person, so we encourage you to today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager Timo Heikkilä (timo.j.heikkila@tietoevry.com)

  

  

We perform background checks on all final candidates.

Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.


#LI-Hybrid

  

Additional Information  

At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. title: Lead Software Architect - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
Luleå, Sweden


* Full-time
* Application and Product Development
* Hybrid
* Tietoevry Care

Job Description **At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.**

 **About us**


Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.

  

We are a global team of professionals working on providing products and services to different sectors from healthcare to social care. In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. From enabling healthcare professionals to spend more valuable time with their patients to providing data for professional athletes to achieve even better results, we make all that possible. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.

 **About the role**


Are you passionate about leveraging modern technologies to revolutionize healthcare? If so, we invite you to join our dynamic and innovative team as a **Lead** **Software Architect**! We're a tech-forward company dedicated to enhancing health and social care through open platforms, ecosystems, and adherence to leading healthcare standards like FHIR and openEHR.

  

We work in an agile, multinational organization that develops cutting-edge products and services for both public and private sectors across the Nordic countries. Our teams are committed to creating, supporting, and delivering modern solutions used by healthcare and social care professionals throughout the region.

  

While we've listed several skills and experiences that we believe would be beneficial for this role, please don't be discouraged if you don't tick every box. We're primarily looking for a Lead Software Architect who is eager to learn and grow with us.

 **With us you will be responsible for:**

* **Leading Product Design and Architecture**: You will lead architectural decisions that shape the future of our healthcare solutions, ensuring scalability, security, and alignment with industry standards
* **Collaborating with Global Teams and Customers**: You will understand their needs and translate them into effective technical solutions
* **Engaging with Customer Stakeholders**: You will build strong relationships to maintain a clear and predictable product vision
* **Identifying and Mitigating Risks**: You will detect gaps in architecture, security, deployment, and configuration, proposing solutions to minimize risks and enhance system integrity
* **Mentoring and Coaching Team Members**: You will guide them in resolving complex technical issues and foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement

 **We are looking for someone with:**

* Extensive Experience in Software Development and Architecture, with a proven track record in designing and implementing complex software systems
* Knowledge of Cloud and Containerization, including proficiency in public and private cloud platforms and container technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
* Expertise in Healthcare Standards like FHIR, openEHR, and SMART on FHIR to ensure interoperability and compliance
* Visionary Architectural Skills to conceptualize and design holistic solution architectures that meet current and future needs
* Agile Methodology Proficiency, with experience working in agile environments utilizing methodologies like Scrum or Kanban
* Strong Technical Skills in microservices architecture, RESTful APIs, web development, and design patterns
* Programming Expertise, with excellent coding skills in languages such as C# and experience with frontend frameworks like Angular
* DevSecOps Experience, with exposure to integrating security practices into the DevOps process to ensure secure and reliable software delivery

 **As a person you are:**

* Solution-Oriented, always focused on finding effective resolutions
* Self-Motivated & Self-Organized, with the ability to manage your own tasks efficiently
* Independent and Responsible, capable of taking ownership of your work
* A Good Team Player, with attention to detail and the ability to collaborate well with others

 **What’s in it for you?**


With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work of developing healthcare for all of us. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.

  

Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle. We want to encourage you to keep up that curiosity and deepen your knowledge on topics you’re interested in. For example, we host a ‘Keep Learning Week’ twice a year, a week where everyone at Tietoevry has the possibility to join different training courses in a truly global setting.

 **Could you be our new colleague?**


We look forward to hearing from you! We will fill the position as soon as we find the right person, so we encourage you to today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager Kari-Antti Kuosa (kari-antti.kuosa@tietoevry.com)

  

We perform background checks on all final candidates.


Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.

 **About Tietoevry**


Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.

  

Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.


#LI-Hybrid

  

Additional Information  

At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.
