 We are a green tech company with young creative minds.
   

  

 We are fighting every day to make our mission happen –
 **Clean Power for All** 
 !
   

  

 With 650+GW of clean power presently installed worldwide, we are on the road to success!
   

  

 Welcome at Sungrow
   

  

 Founded in 1997 by University Professor Cao Renxian, Sungrow is a leader in the research and development of solar inverters with the largest dedicated R&D team in the industry and a broad product portfolio offering PV inverter solutions and energy storage systems for utility-scale, commercial & industrial, and residential applications, as well as internationally recognized floating PV plant solutions, NEV driving solutions, EV charging solutions and renewable hydrogen production systems.
   

  

 Want to know more? Check out what working with us is like!

title: Senior Legal Counsel (Nordics)
PLM Solution Architect
description:
The world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your Role**
 We’re looking for Senior Solution Architects with experience from Teamcenter, 3DExperience or Windchill, who can bring value to the team and work as a key resource in our PLM projects. You will act as a creator of architectural design, defining system requirements and use cases to address overall business requirements, ensuring that the technical solution remains aligned and delivers value throughout any project. Location can be in Stockholm, Gothenburg or Malmö.
   

  

* Engage in Customer Project Delivery Activities
* Conduct requirements gathering sessions and workshops
* Analyze customer requirements and take ownership of high / low level design for PLM and other associated systems
* Propose, plan, design and communicate architectural solutions with Capgemini, Software vendor architects and customers
* Produce written specifications that align with customer requirements for proposed solution and configuration activities
* Identify issues, risks and provide input on solutions to key stakeholders
* Explain requirements, design and configuration requirements to onsite / offshore team members
* Guide team as required to ensure deliverables meet customer expectations
* Demos to key stakeholders as required during requirement gathering and in later stages for UAT etc.
* Participate in customer delivery and cutovers as needed.
* Actively contribute to Pre-Sales Activities
* Work with sales for budgetary proposals


**Your profile**
* University degree, preferably in the fields of Computer Science or Engineering
* Demonstrated expertise in developing and deploying solutions based on Teamcenter, 3DExperience or Windchill
* At least 4 years of experience working in a Nordic country
* Proven IT development experience as well as experience of multi-cultural project teams, where parts are located off-site
* Excellent communication skills in English, both orally and written
* Swedish work permit or Swedish citizenship


 Meritorious skills
   

  

* Swedish communication skills, both oral and written
* Past coding experience on Java, JSP, MQL, EKL, Widgets
* Knowledge of data migrations
* Working knowledge of CAD tools, PLM-CAD-ERP and other enterprise integrations


 We are looking for a team player who sees the team’s contribution as the ultimate goal. Additionally, you should be a self-going and communicative person with natural leader instincts, drive and independence.
   

  

**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications.


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Senior Business Development Manager, Visa Commercial Solutions
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 What is it all about?
   

  

 Visa Commercial Solutions team is responsible of driving the sales of Visa Commercial products and solutions towards Visa clients across the cluster. Our teams work in close collaboration with Account Executives and other internal stakeholders and teams. We are fueled by a diverse team of talented team-members who continuously raise the bar on delivering best-in-class products and services to our clients.
   

  

 This role will report into the Head of Visa Commercial Solutions in Nordic and Baltic region. This is a unique opportunity to be part the fast-moving world of payments.
   

  

 This role will be responsible for partnering with regional leader to achieve aggressive sales targets and contributing to the continued growth of Visa Commercial Solutions by driving new sales growth.  We will be working in an agile environment so this person must be proactive in ensuring we achieve our goals, and skilled in pivoting and adjusting as new information and opportunities come to light.
   

  

  

  

 What we expect of you, day to day.
   

  

 Leads prospecting and new customer acquisition strategies for opportunities beyond existing Visa relationships in consumer business and builds relationships with new stakeholders
   

  





  

  

 Works closely with Account Executive to coordinate opportunities with overall customer success plan and account plan
   

  





  

  

 Researches customer and market trends to identify potential new clients and opportunities, introduce innovative solutions, and position Visa as a market leader
   

  





  

  

 Assesses deal potential after identifying new opportunities based on strong Visa product and solution knowledge, and maintains cross-functional relationships to pull in specialists where needed to drive deals forward
   

  





  

  

 Anticipates and uncovers client needs, giving them confidence that Visa can address their needs and jointly achieve their business objectives
   

  





  

  

 Leads with a client-first sales mindset and creates custom, differentiated solutions that grow Visa and clients business
   

  





  

  

 Leverages internal (e.g., Legal, Finance, Risk and Compliance, Marketing) and external partnerships to bring the best of Visa to clients
   

  

  

  





 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

**Experience**



* Senior level B2B sales experience, particularly in digital or payment product or solutions
* Experience selling to banks and fintech customers



  

  

**Knowledge Focus Areas**



* Knowledge or card issuing and or payments in general
* Deep knowledge of the various sales cycles and stages



  

  

**Skills and competencies**



* Lead new customer acquisition activities and effectively manage them throughout the entire sales cycle.
* Work collaboratively across internal Visa functions to build a Visa network, solve complex problems, and serve as the face of Visa to external partners.
* Passion for and interest in Payments and Commercial Solutions with client-relationship building skills, presence, knowledge of sales strategies and priorities.
* Resilient when faced with challenges and has the ability to execute on ambitious goals.


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Senior Core Platform Engineer
description:
**Job Title**
 Senior Core Platform Engineer
   

  

**Job Description**
*Do you want to work with the latest technologies and highly skilled colleagues, at a world leading company?* 
*Then you might be the one we are looking for to join us at Technologies, one of the departments within Axis R&D, with responsibility for developing Axis product platforms that are the base for all Axis Video Surveillance Products.*
**Who is your future team?**
 Product Platforms is a key part of the Technologies department at Axis R&D. Currently, it consists of four highly skilled and motivated R&D teams based in Lund, featuring a great mix of junior and senior team members. Our teams value personal growth, collaboration, and teamwork. If you're someone who enjoys making an impact and contributing to positive change, you'll feel right at home with us.
   

  

 We are now expanding and building a new team in our Stockholm office to strengthen our capabilities.
   

  

 The Product Platforms team in Stockholm will play a vital role in developing and configuring the software for Axis' new technology platforms based on our in-house engineered ARTPEC system-on-chips, which will be used in our next generations of video surveillance products. The platforms we develop are Linux-based and the the development environment is also Linux. The initial work for the team will focus on requirements, design, implementation, and validation of the boot, security and CPU subsystems. In addition to working closely with some of the Product Platform teams in Lund, the new team will also collaborate closely with the ASIC team based in our Stockholm office.
   

  

**What you’ll do here as Senior Core Platform Engineer?**
 In your daily work, you will typically engage in the following activities:
   

  

* Collaborate with ASIC design engineers to research and develop solutions for Axis´ ASIC and product platforms, in particular the SW aspects;
+ Participate in design reviews, technical discussions and specifications to ensure the quality and feasibility of solutions.
+ Design, implement or utilize test environments needed to validate and/or optimize our solution designs.

* Prepare SW for and participate in bring-up and validation of our SoCs. This includes debugging issues and implementing solutions.
* Evaluation of hardware blocks, platforms and related documentation (mainly from a SW perspective, Linux kernel in particular).
* Interact with internal and external teams (e.g. customers, partners or suppliers).
* Participate in development and maintenance of existing Linux kernel platforms (e.g. previously developed platforms and products).


 In this role, you will (together with skilled colleagues) mainly be working in the following areas:
   

  

* IP evaluation and selection (primary responsibility).
* All kind of engineering activities related to Linux kernel development (e.g. driver development, kernel configuration, upstream activities, provide domain expertise to other teams, etc).


**Who are we looking for/Who are you?**
 You are an analytic and dedicated person with a strong personal drive and an ability to work both unsupervised and as a part of a team. You have the ability to think ahead and understand and manage consequences of complex decisions or findings. You are good at collaborating with people with different backgrounds (e.g. ASIC engineers, other SW teams, external partners and managers) and have a strong attention to detail.
   

  

**Required qualifications:**
* A master’s degree in computer science, physics, mathematics, electrical engineering or similar.
* Background in Linux kernel development.
* Experience in embedded C development and debugging, particularly close to hardware.
* Familiarity with version control systems and code review tools (Git and Gerrit).


**Additional valuable qualifications:**
* Experience in working with Linux kernel upstream.
* Background including SoC design work from a SW perspective.
* ASIC IP configuration experience.
* A good understanding of the boot process of embedded devices.
* Basic understanding of ASIC design.
* Experience from using QEMU as a tool to make a system simulation environment.
* Experience with Python and Rust development.


 The position is office-based and you will be located in Axis office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**What Axis Have To Offer**
 Openness might be a buzz word in other companies, but at Axis this is the core of who we are. Our most important asset is our ability to cooperate. We have realized that great ideas can come from anywhere. This is why we encourage everybody to contribute and innovate. If you are a person that likes to get involved and make a difference and nudge the world a little bit in the right direction, you will find a home with us.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to be part of building our new R&D office in Stockholm. On one hand, having the advantages of being a small and agile site while at the same time being part of an exciting, successful organization that is already the world leader in network video.
   

  

 We offer benefits such as flexible working hours, morning fika every day, company bonus, attractive wellness benefits, health insurance - to name a few.
   

  

 We hope you are really inspired by the job description and found a potential match! We are looking forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 If you have any questions, get in touch with Erik Thored, Engineering Manager for the Common Core Platforms team, at +46 46 272 1800.
   

  

 Apply today, we evaluate applications continuously but will call for interviews after the vacation period so be aware that the response time will be a bit longer than usual.
   

  

 Type of Employment
   

  

 Permanent Employment
   

  

 Posting End Date
   

  

 2025-08-15
   

  

*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* 
*Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
**About Axis Communications**
 We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
   

  

 With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
   

  

**Let´s create a smarter, safer world**
 For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
   

  

 Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast

title: Fullstack C#/.NET Career Program, Höst 2025, Stockholm
description:
**Vill du satsa på en framtid som Fullstackutvecklare?**
 Oavsett om du är självlärd eller har programmerat tidigare, erbjuder
 **SALT – School of Applied Technology** 
 en intensiv, praktisk och kostnadsfri 13-veckorsutbildning i C#/.NET, frontend och molnteknik. Här får du inte bara teknisk kompetens – du utvecklar också de färdigheter som krävs för att lyckas som konsult i en bransch i ständig utveckling.
   

  

**Plats:** 
 Kungsholmen, Stockholm
   

  

**Start:** 
 1 oktober 2025
   

  

**Efter utbildningen:** 
 Vi matchar dig med uppdrag hos ledande företag, med möjlighet till anställning hos kund.
   

  

**Vad får du lära dig?**
 Utbildningen ger dig praktisk erfarenhet av att utveckla moderna, skalbara applikationer i C# och .NET. Du arbetar i team med verklighetsnära projekt och utvecklar både teknisk och konsultmässig kompetens.
   

  

 Utbildningen är uppdelad i flera moduler där du steg för steg lär dig de centrala delarna av modern systemutveckling enligt nedan:
   

  

* Programmering i C# med fokus på objektorientering, asynkron programmering och avancerade koncept som designmönster, SOLID-principer och beroendehantering
* Webbutveckling med ASP.NET Core, inklusive MVC-arkitektur, API-utveckling, testning och dokumentation
* Moderna frontend-ramverk som React och JavaScript (inkl. TypeScript) för att bygga responsiva och användarvänliga gränssnitt
* Databaser och datahantering, inklusive SQL, Entity Framework, Dapper och migreringar
* CI/CD och autentisering med verktyg som GitHub Actions, JWT, OAuth och säkerhetsprinciper
* Molnutveckling i Azure, såsom webbappar, lagringslösningar och cloud-arkitektur
* Fullständig projektcykel – från planering, utveckling i team och agilt arbetssätt till slutlig presentation och molnbaserad driftsättning
* Agilt samarbete i team och kodkvalitet i fokus
* Intervjuträning, konsultmässighet och verkliga projekt


**Viktigt!**
**Innan utbildningen startar krävs att du genomför en obligatorisk precourse online** 
 , där du får individuell återkoppling från våra instruktörer. Det ger dig en trygg och stark start i programmet.
   

  

**Är du den vi söker?**
 Vi söker dig som har god
 **samarbetsförmåga,** 
 är
 **kommunikativ** 
 och
 **flexibel.** 
 För att lyckas i uppdraget ser vi även att du har ett starkt
 **självledarskap** 
 och ett
 **lösningsorienterat** 
 arbetssätt – du tar ansvar, är proaktiv och ser möjligheter snarare än hinder.
   

  

 En framgångsrik konsult besitter både teknisk kompetens och välutvecklade mjuka färdigheter, kombinerat med ett professionellt och engagerat förhållningssätt.
   

  

**Du behöver även:**
* Ha kodat regelbundet det senaste året
* Behärska svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* Ha giltigt arbetstillstånd i minst 2 år
* Vara bosatt i eller nära Stockholm
* Ha avslutad eftergymnasial utbildning och arbetslivserfarenhet


**Meriterande:**
* Kunskap i objektorienterad programmering (OOP)
* Erfarenhet av git och GitHub
* Tidigare IT- eller systemutvecklingserfarenhet
* Kandidatexamen eller master


**Övrig information:**
* Programmet är kostnadsfritt men obetalt – första lön utgår retroaktivt efter påbörjad anställning. Du behöver därför kunna försörja dig under utbildningsperioden.
* Ansök senast: 4 augusti – urval sker löpande!
* OBS: Vår rekrytering har ett sommaruppehåll v. 28–31. Ansökningar som inkommer då behandlas därefter.


*Frågor? Kolla in
 *vår* 
 FAQ på vår hemsida eller kontakta oss direkt!*
****Vi är stolta över att vara en jämlik och inkluderande arbetsgivare som välkomnar individer av alla kön, bakgrunder och erfarenheter. SALT:s kultur är öppen, dynamisk och mångfaldsdriven – här formar vi framtidens techkonsulter tillsammans.****

title: Workstream PMO - Sales & Commercial Operations
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This Position reports to:


Commercial & Pricing Excellence Manager **Your role and responsibilities**


In ABB Robotics we are now looking for a **Project Manager** to join our **Sales & Commercial Operations team** to lead the **Project Management Office (PMO) for our functional Workstream** as part of the spin-off of the ABB Robotics division.


In this role, you will play a key part in planning, coordinating, and tracking the key activities across our function. You will work closely with cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders to ensure structured program governance, on-time delivery, and alignment with our commercial goals. Your ability to manage timelines, support workstream leads, and communicate clearly across different levels of the organization will be critical for success.


If you have a background in project or program management, strong coordination skills, and a passion for driving progress in a structured way, we’d love to hear from you.

**Work model:** Fixed term, 12 months

**Job location:** Flexible

  

Join us in supporting the transformation of our global sales & commercial operations!

**Key Responsibilities**


Program Coordination and Planning:

* Support the planning and execution of strategic initiatives across Sales & Commercial Operations.
* Manage timelines, milestones, dependencies, and deliverables for key projects within the PMO scope.
* Maintain and regularly update program documentation, reports, and status dashboards.


Governance and Reporting:

* Set up and maintain governance structures, steering committee routines, and project review cycles.
* Prepare presentations, status updates, and communication materials for leadership meetings.


Stakeholder and Team Collaboration:

* Act as a coordination point between project owners, business leaders, and technical teams.
* Ensure all stakeholders are informed, aligned, and supported throughout the project lifecycle.


Risk and Issue Tracking:

* Identify and document risks, issues, and action items.
* Follow up with responsible owners and ensure timely resolution or escalation where needed.


Tools and Best Practices:

* Promote the use of consistent PMO methodologies, tools, and templates.
* Contribute to continuous improvement of project tracking and reporting processes.

**Your Background**


Education and Professional Experience:

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Engineering, or a related field.
* Project management certifications (e.g., PMP, Prince2, Agile) are a plus.
* Experience in project or program management, ideally in a global or cross-functional business environment.
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Familiarity with project planning and tracking tools (e.g., MS Project, Smartsheet, PowerPoint, Excel).


Skills:

* Excellent communication and coordination skills.
* Attention to detail and structured approach to managing tasks and timelines.
* Strong team player with a collaborative mindset.
* Ability to work independently and drive progress across multiple initiatives.
* Fluent in English, written and spoken.

**More about us**

ABB Robotics is a leading supplier of industrial robots and robot software, equipment, and complete application solutions. We are a trusted partner who continues to redefine robotics automation, focusing on collaborative solutions that allow humans to work safely alongside robots without the need for barriers.

**Recruiting Manager: Domenik Daniel.** **Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Pia Sandström, +4672 525 90 30; Ledarna: Lenny Larsson, +46 706 32 85 47; Unionen: Roger L. Gustavsson, +46 730 30 30 36.**


We look forward to reading your application in PDF format. **Last day to apply is August 3.** Please note that the interview process is ongoing, apply now to secure your spot in the recruitment process!


Please note that to be eligible for employment at ABB Sweden, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check.


We kindly decline direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements.


We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: Planning & Fulfillment Center Manager at ABB Process Control Platform
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This Position reports to:


Head of P&F Automation Products**Your role and responsibilities**
==================================

Are you ready to take the lead in shaping a high-performance supply chain at the heart of a global technology powerhouse? As Planning & Fulfillment Center Manager at ABB Process Control Platform, you’ll drive the strategic and operational direction of our supply planning and inventory processes, ensuring that our cutting-edge products reach customers with precision and speed.


This is your opportunity to lead transformation, optimize critical operations, and build a world-class team – all while making a real impact on customer satisfaction and business success in a fast-paced manufacturing environment.

**Your main Roles and Responsibilities are:**
=============================================

**Operations Leadership**

* Direct daily operations and monitor performance against key operational targets.
* Address bottlenecks and operational challenges to maintain seamless EMS production and order delivery flows.

**Strategic Planning:**

* Develop and communicate strategic plans for supply chain and fulfillment that align with broader organizational goals.
* Conduct regular reviews of operational strategies to identify growth opportunities and efficiency improvements.

**Inventory Oversight:**

* Oversee cycle counting, audits, and reconciliation processes to maintain inventory accuracy.
* Implement proactive measures to prevent overstocking or stock shortages, balancing cost and COTD.

**Cross-Functional Collaboration:**

* Collaborate with procurement, logistics, and product development teams to optimize supply chain performance.
* Ensure smooth communication and alignment between fulfillment, production, and distribution teams.

**Technology & Process Implementation:**

* Lead system enhancement projects for planning, fulfillment, and warehouse management software.
* Implement new technologies and tools to streamline supply chain processes.

**Performance Monitoring:**

* Regularly track and report on operational metrics, providing insights and recommendations to senior management.
* Benchmark performance against industry standards to drive continuous improvement.

**Leadership and Team Development:**

* Recruit, train, and mentor direct reports and operational teams.
* Foster a culture of accountability, innovation, and collaboration across the P&F Center.

**Customer Focus:**

* Ensure customer requirements and expectations are met through effective planning and fulfillment.
* Implement strategies to improve customer delivery lead times and fulfillment accuracy.

**Risk and Compliance Management:**

* Establish risk mitigation strategies to safeguard operational processes.
* Ensure all operational activities are conducted in compliance with regulatory requirements and corporate policies.

**Continuous Improvement & Innovation:**

* Identify and drive continuous improvement projects that enhance supply chain agility and responsiveness.
* Encourage innovation within the team, promoting creative solutions to complex supply chain challenges.


**Qualifications for the role**
================================

* You are highly skilled in Lean Six Sigma, SAP ERP, and warehouse/supply planning technologies, and you enjoy working with operational excellence frameworks and digital supply chain systems in the electronics manufacturing and fulfillment market.
* Have established skills and over **10 years** of experience in operations, supply chain management, and production planning.
* (OPTIONAL: working as Planning and Fulfillment Center Manager with EMS operations, SAP platforms, and advanced inventory control technologies)
* Highly adept in SAP ERP, warehouse management systems (WMS), and performance monitoring tools.
* You are passionate about continuous improvement and are innovative around leadership development, collaboration, and strategic thinking.
* Extensive knowledge of and proven experience in **Industrial Engineering** or **Supply Chain Management or any other relevant studies**
* You are at ease communicating in **English** across global and cross-functional teams.
* You hold current work authorization valid in the job location and comply with country-specific **VISA/work permit** requirements where applicable.

 **What's in it for you?**


We empower you to take initiative, challenge ideas, and lead with confidence. You’ll grow through meaningful work, continuous learning, and support that’s tailored to your goals. Every idea you share and every action you take contributes to something bigger.


Our benefits? Competitive, comprehensive, and crafted with you in mind.

**More about us**

  

Recruting manager: Farshad Afsharian. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Blomqvist, +46 768 06 00 11; Ledarna: Leif Öhrberg, +46 724 64 40 16; Unionen: Krista Andersson, +46 706 44 02 85.


We look forward to reading your application in PDF format. Last day to apply is August 17. Please note that the during the summer months (July-August), we will not review any applicants, and you will probably not hear from us during this time. We will continue the recruitment process in the beginning of August!


Please note that to be eligible for employment at ABB Sweden, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check.


We kindly decline direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements.


We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: HW Agile Product Owner
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Shaping tomorrow's technology**
---------------------------------


At Vehicle Technology, we are passionate about shaping tomorrow’s technology to create excellent sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions to make the world a better place for future generations. We provide innovative, safe and driver-friendly solutions, we develop top quality services, and we make our customer operations more efficient by using excellent data insights. We support the Volvo Group engineering community with cutting-edge tools and methods.

  

Thermal Management is a department within Vehicle Technology responsible for developing, delivering, and maintaining an optimized cab climate and vehicle cooling & heating systems for all types of propulsion installations to all truck brands within the Volvo Group. We are responsible for leading the work with strategies and advanced engineering globally. We are located at Gothenburg & Bangalore, and we have close cooperation with the sites in Greensboro and Lyon.

  

In the Thermal Management Hardware Team, you will play an important role in ensuring the successful creation and deployment of a product, from initial concept through to production and maintenance.

  

Join the Thermal Management Sub Stream, within the Vehicle Motion and Thermal Management department. Embark on the journey to develop the future Volvo Group Thermal Management systems and functions.

**What’s in it for you?**
-------------------------


We are looking for an HW Agile Product Owner to lead the Cooling Module Electric Vehicle (EV) team.

  

As the Agile Product Owner for the Cooling Module EV team, you will lead the development of mechanical and mechatronic components for the next generation of all truck brands and markets within the Volvo Group. This includes key elements of the thermal management system such as heat exchangers, radiators, recirculation shields, fan rigs, high-voltage fans, and low-voltage fans.

  

Acting as the bridge between stakeholders and cross-functional agile teams, you will be responsible for defining product requirements, prioritising features, and driving the development of high-quality, safety-compliant mechatronic systems and mechanical components under Thermal Management responsibility.

  

As part of the thermal management team, you will collaborate closely with your peers, sharing progress and aligning targets to maximize the collective output and ensure efficient and innovative thermal solutions.

  

Key responsibilities in this role includes:

  

* Stakeholder Management, to collaborate with Epic Owners, system architects, system engineers, and internal engineering teams to align on goals and defining the roadmap.
* Leading the Cooling Module EV agile team and secure delivery precision
* Ensure clear alignment on development priorities, technical scope, and delivery timelines with Epic Owners and help the agile team to remove blockers.
* Stay updated on new technologies (e.g., electrification, FCEV) and identify opportunities to improve component performance and reliability.
* Understand the interplay between mechanical, electrical, and embedded software components within mechatronic components.
* Guide the team, managing design complexity, and ensuring functional integration across domains.
**Who are we looking for?**
---------------------------


A dedicated and skilled automotive engineer with a deep expertise in thermal management, electrical system integration, and cooling technologies.

  

A team player with a positive mindset, and curious about the various challenges of development. Having the willingness to effectively build formal and informal relationship networks inside and outside the organisation.  

Being resilient is important for this position; meaning being able to rebound from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations. A person with a structured, analytical mindset—skilled in gathering data, identifying problems, validating facts, and drawing well-reasoned conclusions.

 **In order to be successful in this role, we believe that you have the following background and qualification:**

* M.Sc. degree in in Mechanical, Electrical, or Mechatronics Engineering or equivalent
* Several years of experience from development of mechatronic & hardware components, within the automotive or transportation industry
* Understanding power electronics, and high voltage systems.
* Knowledgeable in automotive industry safety standards, including ISO 26262 (functional safety), and compliance with high voltage safety regulations.
* Multiple years of experience in supplier management and the APQP process
* Structured way of working and ability to deliver complex tasks with excellence
* Good analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Educating/mentoring others within Thermal Management Domain
* Strong communication skills (English - verbal and written)
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


You have the opportunity to use your open mind and can-do attitude to help us steer our transportation solutions toward a more sustainable tomorrow. Come, join us as we take our solutions into a new era and make modern life possible. Let's drive progress together.

  

If you are interested in this position and want to know more you are welcome to contact Denis Bonatto via email denis.bonatto@volvo.com OR Arpitha BG - Talent Acquisition Partner arpitha.bangalore.giri@volvo.com

  

Last Application Date - 17/Aug/2025

  

Please note that due to summer vacations between Weeks 29–32, we will begin reviewing applications starting from 16th August 2025. We kindly ask for your patience and understanding, and we look forward to receiving your application!

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

title: Scrum Master
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Shaping tomorrow's technology**
---------------------------------


At Vehicle Technology, we are passionate about shaping tomorrow’s technology to create excellent sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions to make the world a better place for future generations. We provide innovative, safe and driver-friendly solutions, we develop top quality services, and we make our customer operations more efficient by using excellent data insights. We support the Volvo Group engineering community with cutting edge tools and methods.

  

Thermal Management is a department within Vehicle Technology responsible for developing, delivering, and maintaining an optimized cab climate and vehicle cooling & heating systems for all types of propulsion installations to all truck brands within the Volvo Group. We are responsible for leading the work with strategies and advanced engineering globally. We are located at Gothenburg & Bangalore, and we have close cooperation with the sites in Greensboro and Lyon.

  

We are now looking for an experienced, self-driven Embedded Software Engineer with Scrum Master experience to strengthen our Cab Climate section.

  

Join the Thermal Management Sub Stream, within the Vehicle Motion and Thermal Management department. Embark on the journey to develop the future Volvo Group Thermal Management systems and functions.

**What’s in it for you?**
-------------------------


As an Embedded SW Engineer and Scrum Master for the Cab Climate teams, you plan your work according to the agile principles together with your team.

  

You will support the teams within the section around ways of working, ensuring an efficient workflow and continuous improvements. The responsibility of the Cab Climate section is to develop and maintain cab climate systems for all different truck products within Volvo Group. Within the role you will work with both new development towards future feature/function growth and with maintenance improving the system already on the market.

  

You will have the opportunity to collaborate with many surrounding teams within and outside of our direct organization.

**Who are we looking for?**
---------------------------


We see you as a driven, business-minded innovator who approaches challenges with structure and efficiency. You have a genuine passion for both technology and people, taking ownership of every task you undertake. Motivated by the opportunity to create meaningful change, you thrive in navigating complex environments with confidence and accountability.

  

We also think you have:

  

* An open mindset to learn & grow. Share your knowledge with others
* Good networking skills on a local and global basis and you have an ability to understand and accept cultural differences
* Good communication and presenting skills both in text and verbally (English)

 **Relevant Experience:**

  

* Master’s Degree in Computer, Electrical/Electronic or similar
* Embedded SW development experience
* Experience with control strategy and SW verification
* Experience from Scrum Master role

 **Meritorious to have:**

  

* Knowledge of Automotive Thermal management and cab climate system
* Experience in SIL/MIL/HIL testing
* Experience in Matlab, Simulink, TargetLink, Jenkins, Embedded Coder, C, C++, Python
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


You have the opportunity to use your open mind and can-do attitude to help us steer our transportation solutions toward a more sustainable tomorrow. Come, join us as we take our solutions into a new era and make modern life possible. Let's drive progress together.

  

If you are interested in this position and want to know more you are welcome to contact Frida Gustavsson via email frida.gustavsson@volvo.com OR Arpitha BG - Talent Acquisition Partner arpitha.bangalore.giri@volvo.com

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. title: Software Test Engineer
description:
Business Unit:
Cubic Defense
Company Details:
This role performs software testing to ensure quality of Cubic’s training and simulation software systems.
Job Details:
Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:* Responsible for installation, testing, debugging, support, training and documentation of Cubic’s training and simulation software systems, to ensure operation of Cubic’s training and simulation software systems.
* Manage software testing during the development cycle to verify that software modules have been adequately tested prior to integration and acceptance testing.
* Work with the software developers to incorporate best practice test and validation methods into the software development.
* Establish automated tests capable of repeating low-level test routines on demand in order to detect software issues.
* Plan and follow up the work on regular basis with co- workers and project leader, report the status continuously to the project leader and immediately report any unexpected problems which arise to co- workers and project leader.
* Work with team to produce test plans and procedures.
* Conduct software testing and registering of results.
* Develop automated test routines for software modules.
* Programme in script, macro and high-level application languages
* Research system failures and assist engineers with debugging.
* Installation of Cubic’s simulation software on test system hardware.
* Configure Cubic’s simulation software to a specified site.
* Support, maintain and document software functionality, including operator, installation and maintenance manuals.
* Maintain configuration control and standards compliance.
* Participate in quality management and continuous process improvement.
* Ensure own health and safety and that of others by following all rules and procedures, reporting and managing all hazards in the work area and actively contributing to, and participating in, company health and safety initiatives.
* Comply with Cubic’s values and adherence to all company policy and procedures. In particular comply with the code of conduct, quality, security and occupational health, safety and environmental policies and procedures.
* In addition to the duties and responsibilities listed, the job holder is required to perform other duties assigned by their manager from time-to-time, as may be reasonably required of them.


Minimum Job Requirements:
This section should inform your selection criteria and interview questions, and can be transferred to your interview questions and assessment form.
Skills knowledge and experience:* Experience in performing software testing on application software.
* Familiar with software test methodologies.
* Familiar with Agile Software Development methodology.
* Ability to use MS Office software for word processing and spreadsheets.
* Proficient communication skills in English language, both verbally and writing.
* Experience of using established test tools is preferred.
* Willing to travel internationally when required.
* Strong interest of system development in general.
* Must be able to solve complex and difficult engineering problems.


Education and qualifications* College degree in computer science or other related technical discipline.


Personal Qualities* Communication—Clearly conveying information and ideas through a variety of media to individuals or groups in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the message.
* Interpersonal Skills - Relates to people at all levels, confident, cheerful pleasant deposition, team player, “can do” attitude
* Problem Solving and Decision Making— Making high quality decisions in a fast paced environment; assessing the situation and determining when it is appropriate to use an accelerated approach and when to slow down the process and apply a more analytical approach; committing to an action that takes into consideration time, resources, constraints and probable consequences.
* Technical / Professional Knowledge & Skills—Having the required level of technical and professional skill or knowledge in position-related areas; assimilating and applying new job-related information in a timely manner; keeping abreast of current developments and trends in area of expertise.
* Planning and Organising—Establishing courses of action for self and others to ensure that work is completed efficiently.
* Integrity—Interacting with others in a way that gives them confidence in one’s intentions and those of the organisation. Firmly adhering to codes of conduct and ethical principles.
* Drive for results—Setting high goals for personal and group accomplishment. Pushing oneself and others to exceed performance goals and standards.
* Accurate Self In-sight – Demonstrating an awareness of own strengths and development needs as well as the impact of own behaviour on others.
* Approachability/Peer Relationships—Has good rapport with others and can solve problems with others with minimum amount of noise.
* Customer Focus—Making customers and their needs a primary focus of one’s actions; developing and sustaining productive customer relationships.


Worker Type:
Employee

title: Technical Lead
description:
At Tata Technologies we make product development dreams a reality by designing, engineering and validating the products of tomorrow for the world’s leading manufacturers. Due to our continued growth, we are now recruiting for a Technical Lead to strengthen our team in Gothenburg.
  
  

THE ROLE
  
Responsible for handling System Safety in steering systems, requirement engineering. Know how to work with architecture elements. Good know how of ISO 26262 for System safety.
  
This position would be working within Engineering Research and Development area of Tata Technologies and specifically on Vehicle Programs. The fast-paced development provides a challenging environment suited to an engineer who can quickly develop skills in new areas and liaise with and drive other engineers within a multidisciplinary/global team. Our customers expect high standards, and we require staff capable of meeting such demands.
  
  

**AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY:**  

System Safety deliverables for different vehicle variants.
  
Development of ASIL D requirements according to ISO26262.
  
Supplier interaction for correct delivery of content.
  
Alignments with testing team for verification of safety requirements.
  
System Architect – Defining safety requirements/design at all CF/PF level.
  
Supplier acquisition and ESOW support for system safety topics.
  
Validate Safety Goals in vehicle fault injection testing.
  
Test case reviews system safety requirements.
  
Basic electronic design knowledge.
  
  

**EXPERIENCE / KNOWLEGDE:**  

Bachelor’s degree in computer science/electrical/mechatronics Engineering.
  
Extensive experience in automotive systems.
  
Exploratory requirement handling understanding.
  
Understanding of ISO26262
  
Basic knowhow of CAN/CANoe, CANalyzer and similar tools for the analysis and manipulation of CAN traffic
  
Aspice understanding.
  
Systemite’s System Weaver – CarWeaver
  
Have knowledge of TCe (Teamcenter).
  
Experience working with CANoe , CANape , Simulink.
  
Experience working with diagnostics and good knowledge of UDS.
  
Experience in testing on test vehicles.
  
Good understanding of system/software testing and methodologies.
  
Good understanding of vehicle network communication technologies.
  
Good English language skills.
  
Swedish Driver License (B).
  
Track license T1/T2 is advantage.

title: Software Quality Engineer
description:
**What we are looking for**  

  

Our Lifesum team is growing! We’re looking for a **Software Quality Engineer** who wants to lead the work to drive our quality assurance efforts, with a strong focus on testing, reliability, continuous improvement, and product excellence.  

  

Interacting with developers and stakeholders is very much part of the day-to-day, so communication skills are vital. We’re a small, lean team, so we’re looking for strong individuals who can take direction and run with it, challenge the status quo, and work with both team members and stakeholders proactively. You will report directly to and work closely with our Head of Technology.  

  

You will join a diverse team in the Tech department to ensure all elements of our platform are secure, compliant, and scalable.
  

  

We are headquartered in Stockholm but our work reaches millions of people and we have partnerships with some of the most impactful companies in the world. That’s why our work demands us to stay flexible in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
  

  

We hope we can be a great place to develop and advance your career. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to shape how we build and deliver Lifesum's high-quality digital products. Your work will directly impact the reliability, performance, and user experience of our solutions—ensuring that we meet the highest standards as we grow and scale.  

  

  



  

  

##### **What you will do**

* Thoroughly test our mobile applications and web shop, helping us ship with confidence.
* You’re the last line of defence against defects and regressions making it into the user experience, but you take the context and impact of the defect into account when making a judgement call as to its severity.
* Collaborate closely with stakeholders and developers to clarify requirements, identify edge cases, and catch bugs before they reach production.
* Take ownership of the creation and maintenance of detailed, high-quality test cases and test plans for all new features and regression testing.
* Proactively flag issues in user flows and inconsistencies across platforms, advocating for quality at all stages of development.
* Help shape and document QA processes and best practices as we scale.

##### **Who are we looking for:**

* At least 2 years of experience in manual testing, ideally within a product-focused or startup environment.
* You’ve got a sharp eye for detail and a methodical approach to finding bugs, reproducing issues, and documenting test cases.
* You’re eager to learn test automation: you don’t need to be an expert yet, but you should be curious, self-driven, and excited to pick it up.
* You’re experienced at working collaboratively with developers and product managers to define and refine requirements.
* You show excellent communication skills, both written and verbal: you're comfortable reporting bugs clearly, offering constructive feedback, and contributing to discussions.
* You are self-organised, with the ability to manage yours and your team’s workloads around the fast-paced needs of a growing startup.
* You sweat the details, but are able to balance them pragmatically against other commitments.
* Overall, you’re enthusiastic and motivated about quality, user experience, and building software that truly works for people.
* Initially a 1 year fixed term contract with potential to transition to an open ended contract.

 *Nice to have*

* Experience with automated testing frameworks and tools like Postman for API testing.
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and tools (we use GitHub Actions).
* Basic understanding of accessibility, performance, or usability testing.

 **What we do at Lifesum**


Lifesum is a pioneering consumer health-tech company focusing on nutrition as the core focus of health and wellness. Trusted by over 65 million users worldwide, we help and empower individuals to build healthier, more sustainable eating habits that improve their lives every day.


We are striving to build a passionate and innovative team to build user experiences that are meaningful and impactful, and working here will give you the opportunity to make a difference.


As part of our commitment to innovation, we are becoming an AI-first company, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to revolutionize our tech stack, feature design, and development. Our journey to building the world’s leading advanced wellness platform is just beginning. We are committed to continuously improving the user experience and delivering greater value to our global Lifesum community.  



  

**If you think you are the person for us, please reach out! Or send it to a friend who shouldn’t miss this opportunity.**

title: Full-Stack Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $35M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As a Fullstack Engineer at Legora you will build, review and ship amazing products helping legal professionals all over the world in their day-to-day job. You’ll get the chance to work across the entire tech stack with clear ownership and autonomy.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Architect and implement features end-to-end for our web platform
* Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Work with technologies such as Python, React, Node.js, AWS, Azure and Kubernetes
* Drive continuous improvement and challenge us, the industry and yourself


 Who you are
   

  

* A passionate engineer with a few years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* You feel comfortable working across the entire tech stack, with focus on backend development
* You’re autonomous and take pride in the code you write
* You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about software architecture
* Experience in infrastructure and integrations are a big plus


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, London, and NYC, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


**We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve.**
 We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Fullstack GenAI Engineer
description:
**Fullstack GenAI Engineer role - Industry-leading SaaS!** 




  





 If you are an experienced software engineer with a wealth of experience in building powerful GenAI tools for real-world products, and want to do so from scratch, without the volatility of an early-stage startup, this one could be for you!
 



  





 I'm working with an industry-leading SaaS company, whose Cloud-based product is at the forefront of global team collaboration and content sharing through a powerful but lightweight UI and a focus on security and scalability!
 



  





**☁Modern SaaS on AWS - Lightweight yet powerful UI 🖌- Real‑time global collaboration 🌍** 




  





 Having established themselves as a leader in this space, with a global customer base, they are in a fantastic position but see endless opportunity to continually optimize and evolve their product offering. Despite their international presence and enterprise-grade product, they retain a small company feel where everyone has an impact. Approx 40 people in the company, with a cross functional engineering team.
 



  





**AI!** 




  





 Now, they are looking to make major investments into AI, both strategically and financially, building cutting-edge agentic workflows and conversational AI agents which will transform their product.
 



  





**As a senior engineer, you will;** 




  




* Build a brand new AI infrastructure from early stage, working across the full software development and AI lifecycle from experimentation and ideation to Cloud deployment at scale!
* 
* Build new agentic workflows leveraging the most cutting-edge technologies
* 
* Play a significant and driving role in accelerating their AI journey, working in close collaboration with senior leadership from both product and engineering to plan, strategize and define the technical roadmap!
* 
* Work as part of a cross-functional and super talented engineering department. You'd work across the stack and so we think you come from a background in fullstack/backend software development.



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* A senior software engineer with a wealth of experience in fullstack/backend development, with a strong focus on building GenAI tools for real-world products!
* Somewhat of a generalist and a big-picture thinker where you are able to define and drive the technical roadmap alongside the management.
* Experience with: LLMs, AgenticAI, RAG, AWS, IaaC, Microservices, Typescript/Javascript; NodeJS/Python/PHP
* Fluent English speaker
* Swedish citizenship or permanent residence, EU citizenship or full right to work without requiring visa sponsorship.



  





 This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to join a mature and established product company, working on exciting engineering challenges and taking a huge degree of ownership, autonomy and freedom in this companies AI journey!
 



  





 This is a permanent role based out of their stockholm HQ - Hybrid

title: Rendering Software Engineer
description:
Electronic Arts Inc. is a global leader in interactive entertainment. We develop and deliver games, content and online services across platforms. We have a broad portfolio of brands that span the most popular genres.
 



  





 We exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow our employees to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers.
 



  





 Join us in driving the next revolution in games.
 



  





**Frostbite** 




 Frostbite is EA's state-of-the-art multi-platform game development engine. Our global team empowers game creators to shape the future of gaming by developing creative engine features and outstanding tools. We are honored to have thousands of game developers all over the world using Frostbite to create some of the most amazing games and player experiences in the industry.
 



 You will be part of an experienced and passionate team that owns the image quality for the engine: lighting, shadows, global illumination, materials, post-processing, display mapping, etc.
 



**Responsibilities** 




 As a rendering engineer on the Image Quality team, you will:
 


* Develop and maintain our high-level, predominantly visual rendering features in Frostbite
* Collaborate with game team engineers, as well as with the Image Quality and wider Frostbite rendering teams to deliver new rendering features
* Support our game team engineers and artists in adopting, using, and debugging rendering features in Frostbite



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math or related field
* Good communication skills, particularly when collaborating with artists.
* Strong C++ knowledge with at least 4 years of professional programming experience in real-time rendering
* Experience working in rendering on current or last-generation consoles (PS4, XB1, Switch, PS5, XBSX, PC)
* Experience in one or more modern graphics APIs (DX12, Vulkan, console, etc)
* Good knowledge of modern cpu/gpu hardware architectures
* Experience with Graphics Debugging Tools (PIX, Renderdoc, console tools, etc)
* Experience with memory management and multi-threading, with related debugging and optimization experience



  





**Bonus Qualifications** 



* Significant experience using source control systems (p4, git) in large code bases
* Good theoretical knowledge on lighting, material response, etc
* Experience implementing dynamic GI systems

title: Financial Data Engineer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 - We’re hiring a full-stack analyst to build the financial brain of Lovable. You’ll own our core revenue and retention metrics, stitch together product and billing data, and help the business make fast, informed decisions. The perfect mix of finance rigor and product-minded execution.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* 3-6 years in data, analytics, or finance - ideally at a fast-growing SaaS or product-led company
* Deep experience building and maintaining revenue/ARR models
* Strong SQL and hands-on modeling experience with billing and product data
* Comfortable working across the stack: raw data → DBT model → dashboard → executive summary
* Structured thinker who can simplify messy data into meaningful metrics
* Clear communicator - writes sharp, concise docs and knows how to present tradeoffs


**What You’ll Do**
* Design the ARR model that tracks every dollar, across PLG, sales, upsell, and churn
* Partner with finance and product to lock in metric definitions that everyone can rally around
* Unify product data, billing systems (Stripe), ERP (Light) and CRM (Attio) into one clean, auditable pipeline
* Give leadership and operators the tools to see what’s working, and act fast when it’s not
* Build automated checks, flag data drift, and make sure what we report is always right
* Act fast. Think long. Help drive key decisions now, while building infrastructure that will scale with us.


**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an intro call with the team.
* Complete the take-home exercise
* Show us how you approach problems during two technical interviews
* Join us for trial work lasting 2 days preferably on-site. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal
